metadata.title: CVE-2013-2207 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
pt_chown in GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) before 2.18 does notproperly check permissions for tty files, which allows local users tochange the permission on the files and obtain access to arbitrarypseudo-terminals by leveraging a FUSE file system.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-2207` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

glibc-source - 2.23-0ubuntu1
libc-bin - 2.23-0ubuntu1
libc6 - 2.23-0ubuntu1
libc6-amd64 - 2.23-0ubuntu1
libc6-armel - 2.23-0ubuntu1
libc6-i386 - 2.23-0ubuntu1
libc6-pic - 2.23-0ubuntu1
libc6-ppc64 - 2.23-0ubuntu1
libc6-s390 - 2.23-0ubuntu1
libc6-x32 - 2.23-0ubuntu1
locales - 2.23-0ubuntu1
locales-all - 2.23-0ubuntu1
multiarch-support - 2.23-0ubuntu1
nscd - 2.23-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: glibc package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.23-0ubuntu1').
